skill.name: Marketing Demand & Acquisition
skill.description: Multi-channel demand generation, paid media optimization, SEO strategy, and partnership programs for Series A+ startups. Includes CAC calculator, channel playbooks, HubSpot integration, and international expansion tactics. Use when planning demand generation campaigns, optimizing paid media, building SEO strategies, establishing partnerships, or when user mentions demand gen, paid ads, LinkedIn ads, Google ads, CAC, acquisition, lead generation, or pipeline generation.
skill.summary: Expert acquisition playbook for B2B SaaS startups scaling paid media, SEO, and partnerships with HubSpot integration.
skill.author: Alireza Rezvani

security_audit.summary: Legitimate marketing documentation skill. Static analysis flagged 81 pattern matches in markdown documentation, all confirmed as false positives. No executable code performs system operations, command execution, network calls, or cryptographic functions. The skill contains only documentation templates and a pure mathematical CAC calculator.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Backticks are markdown code block delimiters for template examples like UTM parameters and campaign names. No subprocess, os.system, or actual command execution code exists in any file.
Keywords like 'SHA' appearing in prose contexts like 'Share' and 'hash out' trigger false positives. No MD5, SHA-1, DES, RC4, or weak cryptographic implementations exist in any file.

Standard marketing terminology like 'audit', 'track', 'monitor', and 'crawl' describe legitimate SEO practices (e.g., Screaming Frog crawler). No system scanning, network probing, or reconnaissance code exists.
Line 177 references LinkedIn ad campaign hierarchy structure, not network operations. No network code or API calls exist in the skill.

content.value_statement: Marketing teams struggle to scale customer acquisition efficiently. This skill provides ready-to-use frameworks for paid media, SEO, partnerships, and HubSpot integration to generate pipeline predictably.
actual_capabilities: Create multi-channel campaign briefs with budget allocation and success metrics
Calculate blended and channel-specific customer acquisition cost (CAC)
Build HubSpot lead scoring, attribution, and workflow configurations
Develop SEO strategy with keyword tiers, on-page templates, and link building tactics
Establish partnership and affiliate programs with commission structures
Set up international expansion playbooks for EU and North American markets
limitations: Does not connect to live ad platforms (LinkedIn, Google, Meta) for real-time data
Does not provide actual customer data or replace CRM systems
Requires manual input of campaign metrics for CAC calculations

use_cases.title: Plan quarterly campaigns
use_cases.description: Create multi-channel campaign briefs with budget allocation, audience targeting, and KPI frameworks.

use_cases.title: Optimize ad performance
use_cases.description: Access channel-specific playbooks for LinkedIn, Google, and Meta ads with bid strategies and creative frameworks.

use_cases.title: Build organic strategy
use_cases.description: Develop keyword research frameworks, on-page optimization templates, and link building strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Campaign Brief
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a campaign brief for a LinkedIn ABM campaign targeting enterprise accounts. Include budget allocation, audience targeting, success metrics, and HubSpot tracking setup.

prompt_templates.title: CAC Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me calculate CAC for my marketing channels. I spent $15k on LinkedIn (10 customers), $12k on Google Search (20 customers), $5k on SEO (15 customers). Provide benchmarks.

prompt_templates.title: SEO Blueprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a technical SEO audit checklist and on-page optimization template for our product comparison pages targeting high-intent keywords.

prompt_templates.title: Partnership Program
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an affiliate program structure with commission tiers, partner recruitment strategy, and HubSpot tracking configuration.

output_examples.input: Create a LinkedIn campaign brief for Q2 targeting enterprise software companies
output: Success Metrics: 50 SQLs, <$300 CAC, 10% MQLâ†’SQL rate
HubSpot Setup: Campaign ID, +20 lead score for download, +30 for demo request

output_examples.input: Calculate CAC for our channels and compare to benchmarks
output: Blended CAC: $692 (Target: <$300) - Overall CAC too high

best_practices: Use multi-touch attribution (W-shaped model) for hybrid PLG/sales-led motions to credit the full customer journey
Start paid campaigns with manual CPC bidding for control, then switch to Target CPA after 50+ conversions
Set up HubSpot lead scoring (+10-30 points for campaign engagement) before launching major campaigns
anti_patterns: Avoid relying on last-touch attribution alone, which ignores the nurturing influence of awareness campaigns
Do not scale campaigns immediately; test for 2 weeks minimum and ensure CAC is below target before increasing budget
Avoid generic audience targeting; narrow targeting by job title, company size, and industry improves lead quality

faq.question: What CAC benchmarks should I target for B2B SaaS?
faq.answer: LinkedIn Ads: $150-400, Google Search: $80-250, SEO/Organic: $50-150. Target blended CAC under $300 for Series A.

faq.question: How do I set up HubSpot attribution for multi-touch?
faq.answer: Use the W-shaped model (40-20-40 split) for hybrid motions. Credit first-touch for awareness, last-touch for conversion, middle touches for nurturing.

faq.question: Which paid channel works best for B2B enterprise?
faq.answer: LinkedIn Ads are most effective for B2B enterprise targeting. Use Google Search for high-intent capture. Meta works better for SMB and lower ACV products.

faq.question: How long should I test a campaign before scaling?
faq.answer: Run tests for minimum 2 weeks with 1000+ visitors per variant. Do not scale until CAC is consistently below target. Kill underperformers fast.

faq.question: What makes a good affiliate commission structure?
faq.answer: Tier 1 influencers: 30% recurring or $500 per SQL. Tier 2 bloggers: 20% recurring or $300 per SQL. Include bonuses for top performers.

faq.question: How do I expand to EU markets?
faq.answer: Ensure GDPR compliance with double opt-in. Translate content for DE, FR, ES. Use localized domains (domain.de). Prioritize LinkedIn for B2B.
